boardgame.name: Battle of the Nations 1813: Connewitz & Wachau
boardgame.description:
Expansion 1 (Connewitz) contains a rule (additional actions). The tiles that are needed to play the expansion are inside the base game.

Expansion 2 (Wachau) contains wooden figures (and a new rule). It allows to play the game with 3 players.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Battle of the Nations 1813

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 3 Spieldauer: 45 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 12+
BATTLE OF THE NATIONS 1813 - 1. UND 2. ERWEITERUNG Connewitz / Wachau
1. Erweiterung - Connewitz Die erste Erweiterung beschreibt die Verwendung der 4 Geländetafel, die bereits im Basisspiel erhalten sind
2. Erweiterung - Wachau Die Erweiterung "Wachau" ermöglicht es das Spiel "Battle of the Nations" mit 3 Spielern zu spielen. Im Gegensatz zum Basisspiel spielen die Spieler nicht mit einer Armee (Napoleon oder Schwarzenberg) sondern dürfen mit beiden Armeen agieren. Ziel der Spieler ist es, 3 Aufträge zu erfüllen. D.h. mit den eigenen Armeen, die Orte auf der Auftragskarte zu besetzten und bis zum Spielende erfolgreich gegen gegnerische Armeen zu verteidigen. Dabei spielt es keine Rolle, ob die Spieler den Ort mit einer französischen Armee oder einer Alliierten Armee besetzt halten.
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN
Title: Battle of the Nations 1813: Connewitz & Wachau Publisher: Clicker Spiele Language(s): English German

boardgame.name: Trolldilemma
boardgame.description:
In this fantasy card game, the players play troll bandits competing for the most COINs.

Each turn, a player reveals as many cards ('TRAVELLERS') as there are players. Each traveller has an initiative score and will be assigned to each player - the player with the most SKULLs (see below)receives the highest priority card, and so on.

Each TRAVELLER either gains or costs their player coins, or introduces a new mechanic into the game. The higher the priority, the higher the rewards of a TRAVELLER card, but the higher the chance the card will be negative for the player.

Before each card is assigned, players can assign SKULLs to other players, themselves, or no one at all. This happens simultaneously, and after the cards to be assigned cards have been revealed. I.e. if the highest card is costing you a lot of COIN, and you have the most or are tied for the most SKULLs, you will want to give your SKULL to another player and hope you won't get any more, so the highest priority, negative TRAVELLER card doesn't go to you. On the other hand, you don't want to have much less SKULLs as anybody else, as you will constantly miss the high COIN value TRAVELLERs.

There is also a randomised item shop where players can spend coin for one-time or permanent rule changes (redistributing or removing SKULLs, changing priorities, lessen the impact of negative TRAVELLERs, and so on).

The game ends if one player starts and ends a turn with eight or more skulls, as they get to much attention to stay robbing people.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Artificial Life 101: Creating Monsters for Undergrad Students
boardgame.description:
Each player has to gather sets of resources to build a monster from fantasy or sci-fi as a semester thesis. They only have 15 days (rounds) left.

The players gain victory points by turning in sets of resources described by their thesis cards, which are unique to each player and to be kept secret as long as possible. Each thesis emphasises three of the five available resource categories: Science, Magic, Components, Flesh and Energy.

To gather resources, they have to build a laboratory which transform, splits or fuses resources or teleports them all over the place. The players vie for space and race against time to gather the right material in a chaotic card game with a modular playing field and engine-building elements.

Each turn consists of three phases: In the first phase a player adds a tile to or modifies a tile of their laboratory to give it more functions, like turning certain resources into others, duplicating resources or fusing certain resources into more resources of another kind. A smartly planned lab can set of chain reactions to create lots of the wanted resources from any kind of original resource.

In the second phase, they can choose to either feed a new, randomly determined resource into their lab, or let resources in the lab go into the next stage of a reaction.

In the third phase, they can turn in resources gathered in their lab for points or special action cards, which can help them or hinder other players through various bonuses. Turning in resources for points reveals a players thesis to other players, so they can better try to sabotage their labs.

After fifteen rounds, the player who turned in the most relevant sets for their thesis wins. There are multiple strategies to build a functioning lab with their own risks and rewards, and until the last turn there can often be dramatic changes in the score.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Suits: Ladies
boardgame.description:
Medieval knights clashed to prove their bravery, courage and to impress rich and (sometimes) beautiful women. The Middle Ages are a relict of the past, but men are still men afterall and they still want to prove their superiority. So, what is the most reliable and effective way to distinguish a nobleman from a peasant? Oh yes! Duel! Instead of wearing full plate armor they wear equally charming elegant suits. Instead of fighting on the tournament arena, they meet in the underground of secret club called The Suits. Join this elite society and fight for your prestige and ...........*

*) Enter your deepest and darkest desire that you want to fight for (or die for, but it wasn't in the agreement)

And remember that the first and last rule of The Suits Club is - you do not talk about The Suits Club.

This season is different. Why? Because this time female characters are entering to the club.

Each player controls one of five available characters. Each character has his own unique deck of cards. By using your wits, tactics, strategies and of course, a little bit of luck you can show your enemies who is the real gentleman. The Suits is a fast-paced, two-person card game steaming with atmosphere and tactical depth.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Diabolik: Colpi e Indagini
Diabolik: Heists and Investigations
boardgame.description:
In Diabolik: Heists and Investigations, players will experience in first person the "impossible thefts" that are told every month in the comic books, both from the side of Diabolik and Eva Kant, and from Inspector Ginko and the police.

The mechanics are that of hidden movement, but with the exception that when discovered, the criminals will be forced to flee on the main board, visible to all cops. Thanks to the cards, every turn offers different situations.

The Criminals will have to complete two heists out of the three available to win the game and to do so they will have to move hidden in the shadows, leaving traces of their path that the Police will have to find to ruin the plans of the Criminals.

The Police will have the hard job of investigating the traces of Diabolik and Eva, but they are not alone, in fact they will have the opportunity to call four total Police Officers to help, to keep every corner of the city under observation. To win the game, the cops will have to raise the Danger Level to the maximum on the Danger Track. Usually, solving a Clue increases the Danger Level by 1 point, but that's not the only way to do it. On the other hand, if Eva or DIabolik complete a Heist, the Danger Luevel is lowered.

In their turn, each player can perform a maximum of 3 individual actions. The only exception is for drawing, discarding or playing cards, which is a repeatable action.

[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.
[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.
[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Local Pickup:[/b][/size] If you live near Siegen, Germany, local pickup is also possible, with a 3% discount for cash payment.
[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.
[size=14][b]I take responsibility for the safe delivery of your order:[/b][/size] I am a registered commercial seller. Thus, insofar as you are a private consumer, it is required by German law that I take responsibility for any loss or damage of goods that occurs during shipment.
[size=14][b]Looking for something that is not listed here?[/b][/size] I also sell smaller items on BGG here: https://boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/europa_major?pageid=1
If you want to combine items from my other alias, let me know. The flat rate shipping offered there does not apply to the items listed here. The items sold there will typically (but not always) ship for free with the items sold here.
I can also make [size=12][b]special orders[/b][/size] for items that I don't have in stock. Send me a message concerning an item, and I will check for availability and tell you what the price would be.
Title: Diabolik: Heists and Investigations Publisher: Ares Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Le Torri di San Gimignano
サン・ジミニャーノの塔
boardgame.description:
San Gimignano is a small city in Tuscany, Italy famed for the 72 medieval towers built by families to exhibit their wealth and influence. In Le Torri di San Gimignano, a.k.a. サン・ジミニャーノの塔, each player represents a noble family in medieval Tuscany who is trying to build more towers that are higher and more beautiful than those of your rival.

Players start with five cards in hand and four cards in a face-up market from a deck that contains five 5s, six 6s, and so on to ten 10s. They draw and swap cards from an open market, looking to lay out cards of the same value (a plain tower) or of rising values in a run (a colorful tower). Players can add to existing towers, too. After building a plain tower, they receive a bonus effect (a donation) based on the rank of that tower. Players can complete towers by setting them aside as an action; they can no longer add to these towers, but each scores an additional 5 points at game's end.

In the final scoring, players score for having the highest tower, for plain towers that are taller than the opponent's tallest tower in the same rank, and for their colorful towers (# of towers x # of floors total in these towers). The player with the highest score wins.

The game also includes a set of noble cards for an advanced game, with the nobles having special effects in the game.

boardgame.name: Onkel Reje: Verdens Største Prut
boardgame.description:
Press the head of Onkel Reje, and he says what kind of food he wants you to give him. Press as many times as you want - but be careful, cause if he farts, you don't get to give him anything!
First player to deliver all his food tokens to Onkel Reje, wins the game.

The game includes a figure of Onkel Reje, the (in)famous character from Danish children's TV, that speaks (and farts) when you press him - a sure winner for children aged 5-8 years.

boardgame.name: The Wicked Forest
ウィキッド・フォレスト
魔女之森
boardgame.description:
In The Wicked Forest, a.k.a. ウィキッド・フォレスト, players from a village struck by disaster explore a dark forest where a wicked witch rules in the hope of finding "dirty flowers" from which they can produce crystals with the power to cure diseases, grant wishes, and help their loved ones.

In the game, the forest is represented by a 3x3 grid of cards from a deck. You and your fellow players search cards, revealing them one by one, deciding to return home or remain in the forest after each one. If you return home, you receive the dirty flowers on the cards you revealed, then can use them to acquire ability crystal tiles and magic crystal cards; if others return with you, then your share of the goods will be reduced. If you reveal a witch for a second time, you receive nothing and must drop out until the next round.
boardgame.boardgameartist: Gekidan Inu Curry (劇団イヌカレー)

boardgame.name: The House and Temple Of The Flying Blades: 1st Dan Expansion
boardgame.description:
Ninja techniques have improved since the last skirmish. Now the dojos can use a new set of stealth movements and also a new weapon.

Also the House now has a few columns were the ninjas can hide behind.

This expansion works for any number of players (2-5).

-description from publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The House of the Flying Blades
The Temple of the Flying Blades

boardgame.name: Perfumery
パフューマリー
퍼퓨머리
boardgame.description:
パフューマリー (Perfumery) is a game from Japan with players developing perfumes from combining natural and artificial scents. The game includes the use of a Winchester draft, where one player gains cards for themselves, but this also provides cards for the other players.

Players use Perfumer Pieces to perform actions and expand their Top, Middle, and Base notes. Use those notes to make perfume according to the recipe of Perfume Card in hand. The perfumes produced add value to the parfumier's brand. The winner is the player who created the highest end brand.

The mix of drafting, worker placement, and building combos in tableaus make this a heavier game for older players.
user summary

listing.notes: NIS. Buyer pays actual shipping from US 35803.

boardgame.name: Caverna: Fiese Feinde
Caverna: Frantic Fiends
boardgame.description:
Orcs are ravaging the lands and threatening your caves and families! Can you defeat the ravaging orcs and bring back peace and prosperity to your people?

In Caverna: Frantic Fiends, the second large expansion for Uwe Rosenberg's Caverna: The Cave Farmers, you have to face these hostile plunderers. Luckily, you can either use your proven axes to teach them a lesson or build traps to keep them away from the cave entrances altogether. You can even push them into these traps with stone or bribe them with wood to weaken their strength. Defeating orcs will bring precious rewards, but if you fail to drive them off, all your plans might be in jeopardy.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Caverna: The Cave Farmers

boardgame.name: The Albino Hunter
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A JRPG where you play as Kalymn Nox the Albino Hunter.

boardgame.name: 昆虫ゲッチュ！ (Catch the Bug!)
boardgame.description:
昆虫ゲッチュ！ (Catch the Bug!) is a game from Japan about kids out on a bug hunt.

Players place square cards on the table, building up a grid of bug cards and squads of kids hunting the bugs. When the tableau is complete, players score for the bugs they have secured.

Players try to get their kids to form intersects around some bugs. This means that only one squad can catch each bug.

The kids are ranked by their skills 1-3 with the older kids better more able, and the bugs are also valued 1-4 and -3. Kids can only catch insects if their individual or combined skills are equal or better than the wisdom of the elusive critters. Catching a risky insect like a hornet scores negative points. If multiple squads are competing, the squad with higher skills in total wins the insect.

As the grid develops, players can place good catches at their own kids, and bad catches onto their opponents. The game is quick and easy to play.

At the finish, the highest total score wins.
user summary
boardgame.boardgameartist: Jyujin Ohtsbo (おーつぼじゅうじん)

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 540 - Nov 2020)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 540
November 2020
Ignorable Theme: What rules systems do you use and why? What rules system does your favorite GM use? Why does that GM like it? What rules system do you dislike most and why?
boardgame.rpg: Good Society: A Jane Austen Role-Playing Game

boardgame.name: Trainz Settle and Carlisle
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A standalone expansion to the Trainz series.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Dice Pack
boardgame.description:
Support your interstellar starfighter battle for control of the Star Wars galaxy with the X-Wing Second Edition Dice Pack! This Dice Pack contains three red attack dice and three green defense dice, identical to the dice included in the X-Wing Second Edition Core Set. With this tool of convenience at your side, you'll never need to waste time looking for dice when you could be launching your next attack or dodging out of harm's way.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Super Fantasy Brawl: Neoprene Kit
boardgame.description: A stitched neoprene mat will replace the board from the arena, and four player mats will enable to play a 2 v 2 match without any cardboard under your miniatures, tokens and cards.

boardgame.name: Feel-A-Maze
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A puzzle game where you have to guide your ball through a maze over 40 levels.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Armada – Dial Pack
boardgame.description:
The Star Wars: Armada Dial Pack provides players with 10 additional command dials and seven additional speed dials, allowing them to further expand their fleets.

Additionally, this pack includes five pass tokens and six round tokens, giving players additional access to these essential components.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Star Wars: Armada – Galactic Republic Fleet Starter
Star Wars: Armada – Separatist Alliance Fleet Starter

listing.notes: Title: Star Wars: Armada - Dial Pack Publisher: Fantasy Flight Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: ムーチョ de チョーショ (Mucho de Chosho)
boardgame.description:
ムーチョ de チョーショ (Mucho de Chosho) is a party game from Japan.

One player ('parent') lays out four cards showing different themes or ideas about the person, and states how many of them are lies. The other players may ask questions, and after some deduction, they try to pick which card is a lie. If they get it correct, they score, but if they choose wrong, the parent scores a point.

The game is meant as a communication game, which is a very popular form of social game in Japan. The game works as an ice-breaker, and helps people talk about themselves.

The card text is all in Japanese.
user summary

boardgame.name: Polynesia: Expansion Map
폴리네시아: 확장 지도
boardgame.description: This expansion map provides a different configuration of routes for the base game, Polynesia.
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Polynesia: Expansion Map
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Polynesia

listing.notes: Title: Polynesia: Expansion Map Publisher: Ludonova Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Vector Strain
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A bullet-hell shoot-em-up with several ships to choose from.

boardgame.name: Mein erstes Kakerlakak
boardgame.description:
Unlike the original Kakerlakak game, Mein erstes Kakerlakak is aimed at very young players. The mama cockroach — that is, a HEXBUG — runs through a path that loops on the game board. At the start of a round, each player places one of their "food balls" (a colored marble) in the starting location, then you start mama on the path, with her ideally knocking your food through the holes in the path to feed the baby cockroaches that live in the floor. Whoever first has all their food delivered to the babies wins!

Mein erstes Kakerlakak includes a variant for slightly older children in which players try to collect an assortment of food colors to fill their basket first.

listing.notes: Title: My First Cucaracha Publisher: Ravensburger Language(s): English German Dutch

boardgame.name: Criss-Cross
boardgame.description:
Criss-Cross is a simple roll-and-write game for any number of players. Each player has a 5x5 grid of squares.

Each turn two standard dice are rolled and all players enter the sum in an empty box in their grid; 10, 11, and 12 are entered as 0, 1, and 2 respectively.

After 25 turns the grids are full and each player scores their rows and columns: 2/3/4/5 of the same number score 1/3/6/10 points, and 5 sequential numbers (not necessarily in order) scores 5 points. If a row or column contains multiple scoring combinations (two pairs or a pair and a triple) just add the scores for each combination.

The second version of the game (in Dice Games Properly Explained) gives a few variants:


For larger groups it suggests entering two different numbers on each sheet to begin with and playing 23 turns.



In Criss and Cross the rows and columns are totaled separately and you only score the lower of the two numbers.



Criss versus Cross is for two players only; players use the same grid and take turns entering numbers. One player scores rows and the other columns.

boardgame.name: Ma Bell
boardgame.description: Dubbed as the "New Monopoly", Ma Bell is a Monopoly clone with few major differences. The game features cardboard counters depicting telephones as homage to the name (a nickname for Bell Telephone Co.) used as movers and property markers. The property spaces are named after spoofed titles of real stores and businesses of the late 1970s and early 1980s.

boardgame.name: Stop Gap
boardgame.description: A checkers-like game featured in the Quick Winner Family Fun Games line by Hasbro in the 1970s. The game features 48 checkers in orange and yellow. Players take turns filling in the board except for the center circle to set up. An extra checker is used to stack on one of your players to make an "officer". The ultimate goal of the game is to eliminate all of your opponents officers, or force them to be unable to take a move. Single checkers, or "guards" move one space and can either jump checkers to remove them, or move onto a friendly piece to form a new officer. Officers can move any number of spaces in a single direction, but can only remove other officers.

boardgame.name: Top the Top
boardgame.description: Players take turns trying to get 120 points to win the round or game. Featuring 3 different sized tops, 2 stands, a transfer arm, and 3 small crowns. On their turn, players spin the largest top on the scoring base and then must cap the top with a crown before spinning the next sized top on the spinning platform. Then, using the magnet in the transfer arm, players must get the top to spin on the crown of the previous top and repeat with the third top and final crown before the largest top stops spinning and dumps all of the pieces off. Each top and crown has a point value for the highest level the player achieves on their turn.

boardgame.name: Dutch Days
boardgame.description: A simple flip/roll and move game featuring a map of central/south Pennsylvania Dutch country. Produced in Glen Rock PA by Avalon Hill and sponsored by Heidi House. The game utilizes a deck of cards telling you how many spaces to move or roll after you read the fact or quote about the people and places of PA Dutch Country. Also included is a booklet of information and a recipe book that when referenced by a card allows special movement.

boardgame.name: Tiny Reef
boardgame.description:
The planet’s coral reefs are in danger and a group of biologists are taking action to protect them. On a mission to Tiny Reef, they take inventory of the reef animals to make it a sanctuary for marine life.

During a game of Tiny Reef, players draw on their sheet the marine animals they observe, following certain constraints. They earn points by forming groups of Marine animals of the same species and fulfilling some of the goals.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 密林サーチ (Jungle Search)
boardgame.description:
密林サーチ (Jungle Search) is a party game from Japan, with players searching online densely forested retailers (Amaz*n) to find items, and then guessing the most expensive.

Players draw cards with various themes, and players use the internet to search for items fitting the starting letters. Players work out which one costs the most to score points.

The game does require internet connection (not provided), but you do get a whiteboard and marker with eraser, and 45 theme cards.
user summary

boardgame.name: Um Speis' und Trank
Swap
boardgame.description:
Swap is played with four standard dice and 12 chips in each of four colors. Players start with one chip of each color and the rest are placed in a row of supplies.

At the start of each round the dice are rolled and assigned to the chip supplies - the color on the left gets the highest die, the next color gets the second-highest, etc. Then each player in turn may trade; they can turn in chips to the supplies and take chips, but they must obey two rules: the total value of the chips taken cannot exceed that of those turned in, and at most one chip of each color can be traded.

After each round the start player moves. The winner is the first player to have two chips of each color. If playing solo the object is to reach this goal in as few turns as possible.

The book versions of the game include variants:


In Sway Swap the dice are not rolled each round; instead they are rolled all together only at the start of the game. On a player's turn they choose a die to roll, after which they re-order the dice and then may trade.



In Sellout the die rolling is handled as in Sway Swap, but it uses dice in colors matching the chips instead of ordering the dice. In this version the game continues until there is only one chip left in the market, at which point the player with the most chips wins.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: New Tactical Games with Dice and Cards

boardgame.name: Cross Numbers Game
Cross-Number
boardgame.description: Volume IV in one of the Russell little books card game sets. The game features a deck of cards split into four colored triangles with different numbers on them. The goal is to score enough points to win the game, and play your cards to end the round. On their turn players match the colored sides of the cards so that the numbers add to a multiple of 5 to score points, while matching multiple sides can give a bonus as in other domino-style games like Contack.

boardgame.name: Wild West Game
boardgame.description: Volume V in one of the Russell little books card game sets. A simple matching game using cards featuring various motifs of the old American "wild" west. Players take turns drawing cards in the aim to match pairs of cards and law down for points or hold for a gin-style hand. Players have an odd number of cards in their hands so that when all but 1 card is used in a pair that player can use the single card to end the round by calling "cowboy round-up" where hands are scored.

boardgame.name: Domino Cards
boardgame.description: Volume II in one of the Russell little books card game sets. It features a deck of cards depicting dual numbered dominoes and rules to play a number of basic domino games such as traditional dominoes, domino pairs, and Mexican Train.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Russell's Famous Card Games Children's Library

boardgame.name: Spiria Material Card Game StA
boardgame.description:
Spiria Material Card Game StA is a 2 player card game from Japan, based off a previous trading card game called Spiria Material. This game allows players to begin playing in the Spiria Material world with only 5 hand cards each. The game includes just 18 cards for each player, so players can experience playing with a variety of combinations, without having to buy a whole deck of cards.
user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Spimate Production Committee (スピマテ制作委員会 )

boardgame.name: Dragon Quest Trading Card Game
boardgame.description: A 2 player battling card game in the same vein as Pokemon or Magic the Gathering. A collectible trading card game published in Japan featuring many different sets of booster packs, starter decks, and collector's series of cards. The cards themselves depict monsters, bosses, and characters from the Dragon Quest/Dragon Warrior series of games split into 5 different color groups. Players use a deck of monsters and heroes to control the playing field with the help of item, event, and specialty cards as well.

boardgame.name: Rise N Fly
boardgame.description:
A trivia game where players try to score 7 points or avoid having 7 negative points. Players open each round by betting how many of 7 questions they can answer. The highest bidder wins or loses points based on their score. Featuring 4 categories, zinger cards for added gameplay, and features predominantly questions on African-American culture and history.

Can be played in teams.

Marked Olds Ogden & Johnson, Wilmington DE

boardgame.name: Snow White Game
boardgame.description: A simple roll and move children's game based on the Disney adaptation of Snow White & the Seven Dwarves. Players spin the spinner and move their Prince Charming token trying to meet up with the sleeping Snow White. The spinner also feature a magic mirror space, where players must use a small reflective space on the board to read the instructions on the backwards mirror cards.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Snow White

boardgame.name: Dome Basketball Game
boardgame.description: Now you can play the excitement of the domed sports arcade games at home. Much like the more famous and popular domed rod/stick hockey, some arcades had push button domed sports like soccer, football, and basketball. This smaller tabletop version features 8 keys per side to pass, dribble, and shoot the ball down the court. Similar in play style to older sports games such as Bas-Kat by Cadaco. Different sports versions exist by a number of small companies, but the most prevalent seems to be by Hong Kong Toys made from the late 70s to early 90s.

boardgame.name: 2 in 1 Game Flipperz
boardgame.description: Produced by Majik Toys and East Point Sports, Game Flipperz is a double sided game board featuring action based sports games. One side features Pitch & Play Baseball which utilizes ringed marbles as in Rebound as baseballs and a pinball style bat to swing downfield. Players have plastic gates to simulate fielders to prevent the batting player from hitting into the slight wells to score runs. The other side of the board features Fling Football, a traditional paper football style game where players can block out 5 or 10 yard sections of the field with their defense tokens to make it more difficult for the offensive player to make it downfield. It also features a plastic catapult and foam football for kick-offs and field goals.

boardgame.name: Pods
boardgame.description:
Pods is an electronic tabletop game produced by Sega. The game features a three-piece console with dual-level light-up sensors and a central sensor with speakers and additional lights.

Pods feature rules for seven different games at three different skill levels, most of which deal primarily with speed or memory. The three sensors detect when a player puts their hand over them and responds by lighting up either the bottom half at a six-inch range or the top half around twelve inches. Each of the games utilized the lights or speakers in the central piece to direct players when and where to activate the sensors.

boardgame.name: Dilemma
Dubito
boardgame.description:
Dilemma or Dubito is played with two or three decks of standard playing cards. Each player is dealt a hand of eight and the remainder form a draw pile.

On a turn, a player plays one card to their layout and then draws a replacement. A player's layout consists of four lines of cards:


1. Cards that increase in value
2. Cards in the same suit
3. Cards in the same suit that increase in value
4. Cards of the same rank


These lines are fixed at the start of the game (i.e. a player cannot play to a line and decide later which one it is.)

The game ends when no one can play any longer. Players score one point for each card in line 1, two for each in line 2, etc.

The book versions of the game (German and second English) suggest playing with two decks even with more players and also give some variants:


In Subito a player may play multiple cards on their turn, replenishing only after all cards are played. (With two players use just one deck.)



In Judico players do not have hands; instead on a turn a player draws a card and then may play it or discard it. Discarded cards are out of the game. The rules for the lines are relaxed in this version.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: New Tactical Games with Dice and Cards

boardgame.name: Haunted: Get Scared to Death...Repeatedly!
boardgame.description:
Skeptical of the rumors, you and your friends decide to see if that creepy old house on the corner lives up to its reputation.

Finding yourselves locked inside with all manner of horrors, you must fight your way out before the house scares you and your friends to death.

Well, at least they’re your friends for now...

Gain and lose Courage Points as you wander through the house, encountering Scares while gaining protective Totems. But don’t worry, dying of fright isn’t the end. You’ll get to haunt the others to keep them from winning and possibly come back from the dead yourself.

Be the first player to gain all six Totems to beat the house and live to tell the tale!

Quick and easy to learn, light and fun highly competitive game.

This is a hand crafted game, made to order with high quality, durable acrylic components.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Goodman Games 2019 Yearbook Presents: DCC Riders on the Phlogiston
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

The annual Goodman Games community-building sourcebook is back with a new title this year!

One of the most popular releases of the year returns! This annual compilation of articles for DCC RPG includes Riders on the Phlogiston, the 2018 Gen Con tournament adventure module.

This year’s release includes four separate booklets: the adventure module, a player’s pack, a judge’s pack, and a book of handouts. Your local group can play the adventure just like the tournament format that was used at Gen Con and Origins!

In addition, a fifth booklet included herein includes a yearbook of the great new Goodman Games community content from the last year! All of it contained under a gorgeous wraparound cover!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
boardgame.rpgseries: Goodman Games Gen Con Program Guides

listing.notes: Still sealed in original shrinkwrap. ANS

boardgame.name: Operation Battleaxe
boardgame.description:
August, 1941. Rommel has driven the Western Desert Force all the way across Cyrenica. But the Tiger Convey has just arrived bringing tanks, airplanes, ammunition and supplies. General Wavell now has what he need to drive the Germans back, and seize initiative on the North African front.

The Player who best executes combined arms stands the best chance - you need to integrate all aspects of the North African Desert Space. The game is played in alternating turns. Each players forces will be under double digits as this is tactical game that includes basics like Line of Sight, Elevation, Opportunity Fire, Indirect Fire and armor overruns!

Operation Battleaxe is the third of Dark City Game's Combat Boots series of tactical wargames. Each piece is a squad or section of infantry, an individual vehicle, gun, or aircraft. The scale of the board is 50 meters per hexagon, and each game turn covers only a few minutes.

boardgame.name: Gon' E-Choo!
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A retro arcade-style game which also has VR support.

Developed by Marc Ellis.

boardgame.name: Alone in the Fantasy Desert
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Alone in the Fantasy Desert is a hack of Takuma Okada's Alone Among the Stars.

This is a journalling game requiring one player, a pack of 52 standard playing cards and a six-sided die (1d6) or another suitable randomiser.

You are an explorer of fantasy deserts, coming across the remains of former civilisations, lost tombs, dangerous conditions, strange monsters and oddities. Perhaps you will find treasure; perhaps you will get lost.

boardgame.name: 100 Notes and Letters to Find in the Monarchies of Mau
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Characters will often encounter pieces of paper when searching places, or even corpses. Often, these may be important, but important writings shouldn't be the only ones they find. There will be other jottings that people will have written or received. Here are 100 simple notes and letters, threats, orders and warnings, signs of wrongdoing, proof of conspiracies or the ravings of madmen that can be used to disguise what's truly important and to make a setting come to life. Some are quite short and others are longer. These notes are tied to the Urth setting, and could be found in or about a particular location.

Although none are intended to have any meaning beyond being a distraction that appears important, the Guide can, of course, decide whether any of these do have any meaning. These could be used as adventure hooks, or as ways of getting characters to visit certain locations.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

I'd ban most of the visiting cats unless they could first prove they were worthy of being allowed in the library. Many of them simply don't treat books with the proper respect; bending pages, leaving them open, putting them back in the wrong places. It's really annoying.

I'm frozen! When I leave House Siberia's lands, I'm never going to return. I'm going to stay somewhere warm instead. How do they cope with the temperatures?

I'm sick of the stench that tannery sends into the air. What cat thought it would be a good idea having such a vile business within the city's walls?

I'm sure the ministers are lying, or at least hiding the truth in some manner. I don't believe they have a better handle on the souls of cats than any other cat does. But why would they do this? Have they an ulterior motive for it? This is something that needs looking into further.

I'm the last. All the others have fallen to the coatl and I can hear it hunting me now. We were never enough to stop this beast.

Two pages are the front and rear covers, one pages is ads and two the Open Game License and legal.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Unsullied Swordmasters
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Maîtres D'armes Immaculés
boardgame.description:
The Unsullied have one of the most difficult training regimens of any unit. Only about one in three survives to the end. However, those that do are swordsmen of unparalleled skill. Though they look slight compared to most western swordsmen, that does not mean they’re not as strong or effective on the battlefield. When joined with an officer, their skills are only enhanced, trading blow-for-blow with any foe.

The Unsullied Swordsmen unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Targaryen players an effective melee unit on the field. Their melee attacks hit at the weak points in enemy armor, granting numerous bonuses when they strike. The Officer Unit Attachment adds to their strengths, trading wounds with the enemy when being attacked, making this unit able to dish out wounds both when attacking and on the defensive.

Contents:
13 Miniatures
‣ 1 Officer
‣ 11 Swordmasters
‣ 1 Swordmaster Bannerman
1 Unit Card
1 Attachment Card
1 Movement Tray

boardgame.name: 100 Ghostly Apparitions to Encounter
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This supplement has 100 apparitions that characters could encounter. They are suitable, perhaps with some tweaking, for any setting in which ghosts might be expected to be encountered. The apparitions may be reliving the moment of their death, or perhaps following a job or hobby from life. They may be on a cycle, forever repeating the same event, fading away in between, or they may keep doing what they're doing until disturbed in some way. Whether or not an apparition reacts in any way to characters is up to the GameMaster. The apparitions may be impossible to interact with, or it may be possible to disturb them. In some cases, the areas where they died have objects related to their death.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Crawling along the ground is a woman with broken fingernails and long, straggly black hair. She looks up when seen, mouths "Help me," then disappears.

Crouched on the ground is a woman who is digging into the soil with their bare hands. There is still a small mound of moss-covered dirt and a small depression in the ground where they were digging.

Crying is coming from a woman wrapped in a shawl with very little of her visible. Her face, which is hidden by the shawl, is looking down at a small bundle in swaddling clothes that she is holding.

Dozens of rats swarms over a kneeling figure and pull them to the ground. Faint screaming can be heard as the figure struggles, before going still. When the rats leave, only raw and bloody bones are left, which fade from view.

Dragging themselves along the ground by their hands is a shadowy figure, whose legs do not seem to be functioning.

One page is the front cover, one page the front matter and half a page is ads.

boardgame.name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Targaryen Mother of Dragons
Le Trône de Fer: le Jeu de Figurines – Mère des Dragons
boardgame.description:
The Targaryen faction is almost defined by their unique relationship with dragons as both living war machines and companions. This miniatures set brings the Mother of Dragons, Daenerys Targaryen, to the battlefield accompanied by her young dragons. The dragon units will feature the unique ability to fly over other units as well as breathe fire onto their enemies.

The game box includes a Daenerys Targaryen miniature, 3 juvenile dragon miniatures, and character and tactics cards.

boardgame.name: The Fifth Column
boardgame.description:
The Fifth Column is a precursor of Schotten Totten played with a standard deck of cards. In the basic version each player gets a hand of six cards and two rows of nine cards each are placed on the table to start the players' columns. Two cards are discarded and the rest form a draw pile.

On a turn a player plays to one of their nine columns, claims columns if possible, and draws a card. The three-card column sets are ranked from straight flush down. A column can be claimed even if the opponent's set is incomplete if you can prove there is no way they can beat your set. If a column is completed on both sides and is tied, the player who played last loses it.

The object is to claim five columns.

Some variants are given:


Ignore straights and straight flushes.



Each player gets 15 cards at the start and never draws any more.



Don't place any cards in the columns initially, as in the later game.

Knockdown is a dynamic fighting game where you become a fighter and you have to knock down your opponent. boardgame.name: Region
boardgame.description:
The war of the kings is almost over, and few are left alive to win it for the them. The last hope for each side is on the way, but each of them has to hold their ground until their fierce commander arrives. Who can conquer this ever-shifting terrain and not fall victim to their own moves?

In Region, players maneuver their king on the grid to claim free spaces and take back the enemy-occupied spaces by surrounding them, while trying not to be encircled by the enemy. After placing their fifth conquest tile, players can enter their commander into the game. While more powerful, commanders are more restricted in their movement, yet they can turn the tide of the game.

The first player to place all of their tiles wins.

boardgame.name: Elementra: Dragon Academy
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the world of Elementra. In this fast-paced game, players take on the roles of Elementra students in their first year of training - learning how their powers work in combination with their dragon companions.

Use your abilities, strategy, and luck to create the most powerful duo of dragon and rider you can to defeat all other challengers.

boardgame.name: Limelight
boardgame.description:
Limelight is played on a 4x4 grid with the corners cut off using pieces in two colors. White plays first and has 11 pieces, black has 10.

On a turn a player enters a piece on one of the edge spaces, pushing a piece there to the next space and so on. However, pieces may not be pushed off the board.

When all pieces have been played the board will be full. The player with the most pieces in the nine central squares wins.

The game can be played on a larger board with more pieces. If the center region has an even number of spaces and the players tie, the first player wins.

boardgame.name: Deranged Rabbits

User Summary

A platformer featuring Fluffy Bunny as he collects carrots over 75 levels.

boardgame.name: Temples
boardgame.description:
An unavoidable calamity has fallen upon earth, and there is no place to take shelter from the wrath of gods. It's been ages since the last temple was seen. You are summoned as the most adept sorcerers in the world to try building the last temple while competing for the favor of gods — but this is no easy task. You have to build it block by block, infusing each block with magic and hoping that it can withstand what is yet to come.

In Temples, the layout of the game consists of a variable arrangement of block cards in the form of a temple, with each block having a number. You try to play cards with a total equal to the number of each block to either:


Add blocks with larger numbers to your hand, or
Claim the building blocks of the temple and increase your score.


The game ends once every block of the temple has been claimed. Whoever has the most claimed blocks is the most renowned sorcerer and wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Trading Places
boardgame.description:
Trading Places is a trivia game with a theme of traveling around the world attempting to complete business contracts. Money is awarded for this and the winner is the first player to accumulate a million pounds.

Movement is controlled by three dice which determine mode of travel (air, sea, etc.) and other details. While traveling players may answer "En Route" questions to continue. Entering cities requires answering more difficult "Visa Entry" questions and the "Contract Completion" questions are the most difficult.

Some travel spaces have limited capacity so players may have to answer "Challenge" questions to bump other players out.

The En Route and Challenge questions are general knowledge; the Visa Entry questions are more travel-oriented and the Contract Completion questions more business-oriented.

boardgame.name: Eintracht Frankfurt Quiz
boardgame.description:
Eintracht Frankfurt Quiz
A combination of card and dice game containing 244 questions and 976 answers, in 6 difficulty levels.

Rules:
The youngest player begins. if he rolls a 2, the player to his left read out question 2 and the four possible answers on the back. If his answer is correct, he receives 2 victory points.
If he threw a 3, he would be asked the question 3. For the correct answer he would receive 3 victory points. And so on.

Each player only answers one question.
Then it is the turn of the next player.

The winner is the first player to reach 50 points (or whatever victory conditions players agree upon)

boardgame.name: Snik
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A minimalist game where you must collect golden orbs by directing a ball.

boardgame.name: SNIKS
boardgame.description:
Are they caterpillars? Are they worms? They’re SNIKS! Multicoloured little snakes, hungry for fruits. Some of them are into strawberries, others into pears and all the other good stuff. There’s only one problem: They keep getting in one another‘s way while eating. Your task: Untie the Gordian Knot of SNIKS and help them eat all the fruits.

SNIKS is something for your brain, making you puzzle your way through 110 handcrafted levels. SNIKS is also a feast for the eyes: Tasty fruits, hand-drawn environments and colorful sniks form a beautiful fruit salad.

Developed by Shelly Alon

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Spot On
boardgame.description:
Spot On requires a selection of cards from two standard decks: 3 black cards of each value from 3-9 and 12 red court cards. Players also each need a pawn and 12 counters in their color; one side of each counter needs to be marked with a spot.

The cards are shuffled and laid face-up in a 6x6 grid. On a turn a player places their pawn next to a row or column and rolls the die. They count that many cards from the pawn and place a counter on it, spot up, placing on top of an opposing counter if necessary. If necessary the count wraps around to the start of the row/column.

The player may then roll again and place another counter. This continues until they decide to stop or they roll a card which they already have a counter on (from this or a previous turn). In the latter case all the counters they placed this turn are removed. Otherwise they flip over their just-placed counters, remove any opposing counters from these cards, and take any of these cards that are courts. If they have counters on all three black cards of a given number they take those as well.

The game ends when all court cards have been taken. Each set of black cards is worth the cards' number. Each court is a point unless a player has seven or more, which is worth 12 points.

boardgame.name: Subbuteo Shuffle Card Game
boardgame.description:
Subbuteo Shuffle Card Game


Pass the ball from player to player by matching the balls on the cards, then shoot for goal!


The first team to score three goals wins

Includes 45 Player Cards, 6 Goalie Cards and 1 Coin Card


Rules:
1. Pick up your four Players.
2. Work out how many Players you can play in a horizontal line (your ‘pass line’) on the table in front of you. (You can only play a card if the ball on it matches the position(s) of the ball(s) on the card(s) next to it ) when two Player cards are played next to each other, they make a complete ball..
3. If you can play one, two or three Players to start your pass line, do that. If you’re able to play all four Players, only play three onto the table and skip to the Shoot for Goal!
4. At the end of your turn, pick up new cards from your Players pile so that you’re holding four again. Play switches to the other team. Continue taking turns until you can play your fifth Player card into your pass line, It’s time to Shoot for Goal!
You can play all four of your Players on your first turn, OR if you can play a fifth Player on a later turn, it’s time to Shoot for Goal. Choose which Player you’re going to use to shoot for a goal.
The Opposing team: Look at your opponent’s pass line and work out where you think the ball might go next. Choose which of your Goalies you think will save the shot!
Both teams: Play your chosen cards onto the pass line at the same time.
Did your goalie save the ball?

Yes! Give the Goalie back to your opponent and remove your last two Players from the pass line. Put your two Players to the bottom of your pile. Play switches to the other team.
No! GOOOAAAL! Remove all cards that have been played by both teams and put them to the bottom of your Player piles.



Start playing again, with four new Players each, The team that let the goal in takes the first turn.
Then there are special moves Tackling, Substitutions and Passing Back.

The winner of the game is first player to score 3 goals.

boardgame.name: The Tower of Lord Munch
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A D&D 3.5e mini-adventure site for 4–6 Characters Levels 4-5

The Tower of Lord Munch is a mini-adventure that you can use in your existing fantasy adventure. The encounter location comes complete with maps, tokens, and Game Master Story Notes.

On the edge of the King’s personal estate sits the tower of Lord Munch, a dreadful place that peasant folk avoid at all costs. From the tower the agents and informants of Lord Munch traverse the Kingdom, keeping an eye on dissenters and rabble rouser’s who might rally the masses against the rule of the King.

The tower of Lord Munch is quite an unpleasant place to find yourself if you have spoken out against the harsh taxation enforced by the King. While for those who have whispered the words of revolution, the Tower could be the place of your doom.

The tower is the personal home of Lord Alfred Munch, the fellow who acts as the King’s problem solver.

Lord Munch and his retainers are employed as a kind of intelligence service, a group of thugs who arrest and then question “people of interest” to the Crown. Interrogations usually involve a scatter of questions liberally mixed with a harsh beating.

Many peasants and a few Nobles have ended up sitting on a stool in one of the interrogation rooms, answering questions between beatings from their Jailers. Those who have been set free often return home cripples, if they are set free at all.

The tower is a place of dread that is best avoided.

boardgame.name: Grunk's Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A 3.5e mini-adventure site for 3 to 4 Characters Levels 1 to 2

In a cave on the banks of a forest stream, dwells a constantly grumpy old Ogre called Grunk. This old Ogre spends his days fishing or arguing with himself over the mundane – be they real or imagined – trivial things that trouble the muddled minds of Ogres. Occasionally Grunk ventures out from his hovel in search of something to add a little spice to his cooking pot. Which he usually finds in the form of an unfortunate farmer’s cow, or the farmer himself.

Some years ago Grunk re-purposed a collapsed river side cave, by clearing out the rubble and building up the cave walls with stolen stone blocks that Grunk scavenged from a nearby ruined temple. After weaving a roof of thatched branches over the structure Grunk covered his new lair with the dirt that had once filled the cave when it originally collapsed. The passage of years has further concealed the underground structure as wild grass spread across the dirt roof, leaving only the exposed cave mouth as evidence of it’s presence in the landscape.

Grunk the Ogre: You are going to smell Grunk, long before he manages to get his grubby hands around your neck. He is a large hulking tub of overweight Ogre, well fed on stolen sheep, or anything else slow enough to catch (or stupid enough). But don’t let Grunk’s dumb expression get the better of you, he is a crafty Ogre when it comes to finding his next meal. Just hope Adventurer, is not on the menu!

Compass Points are small adventures sites for 3.5e which can be dropped into an existing campaign as a side-adventure or as a stand alone adventure! Each Compass Point includes all of the maps, tokens, and story entries that a Game Master needs to employ the mini-adventure module.

boardgame.name: The Folly of Silenus
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A 3.5e mini-adventure site for 3 to 4 Characters Levels 3 to 4

Silenus was an adventurer, who spent many years wandering far away lands in search of fame and fortune. Over the years Silenus meet many fellow adventurers whom he would come to call, friend. But sadly, adventuring life took its toll, and a number of Silenus’ dear friends fell foul of hazardous dungeon traps and wandering monsters.

Thus when Silensus retired from adventuring life, he setup a small school for adventurers. His hope being, that he could prepare young adventurers for the hazards of adventuring life. As part of the school, Silenus constructed a wizards maze – the Pyramid of Silenus – better known today as the Folly of Silenus. Back in the day, in order to graduate from the school, each student had to enter the Pyramid of Silenus and return with an idol that was hidden inside a special chamber within the maze. Upon returning to the school with the idol, the student graduated as an adventurer, ready to explore real dungeons!

Sadly Silenus succumbed to old age and passed on to the next world. Now with Silenus gone the School of Adventuring lost it’s benefactor and closed down. All that remains of the wizards legacy, is the Folly. Yet even today, it is still enchanted with mighty magic, still ready to teach young adventures a thing or two.

Do you dare explore the Folly of Silenus?

Compass Points are small adventures sites for 3.5e which can be dropped into an existing campaign as a side-adventure or as a stand alone adventure! Each Compass Point includes all of the maps, tokens, and story entries that a Game Master needs to employ the mini-adventure module.

boardgame.name: Cult of the Iron Mask
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A D&D 3.5e mini-adventure site for 4–6 Characters Levels 3-4

The Cult of the Iron Mask is a mini-adventure that you can use in your existing fantasy adventure. The encounter location comes complete with maps, tokens, and Game Master Story Notes.

In the darkness of the middle ages the rights of women folk are often left unguarded by chivalry as men give in to lust, jealousy, or the intricacies of arranged marriages made to foster alliances and cement political power.

The Cult of the Iron Mask is the direct reaction of the women folk of a distant land against the tyranny of wicked men. A secret, militant society of women folk. Who seek vengeance against those who break the vows of chivalry, abusing the sanctity and innocence of womanhood. While also offering safe sanctuary, and a new life to those seeking to flee unjust treatment at the hands of mans lust.

The average follower maintains a secret pact with the cult, watching society as innocent helpless women. Looking on from the windows of peasant hovels, or listening in from the kitchens of merchant lords.

While acolytes of the Iron Mask – normally women folk who have fled terrible husbands or oppressive slave masters – reside in a secret underground monastery. From where, the cult coordinates contacts with women sympathetic to their cause, or under the guise of the dreaded “Women of the Iron Mask,” launch raids to free the oppressed and punish the wickedness of men.

Compass Point Contents

The Cult of the Iron Mask is a mini-adventure site (or as we call it at Studio WyldFurr: a Compass Point) that a Dungeon Master can drop into their campaign as a side adventure or as an adventure all by itself. The package includes everything the Dungeon Master needs, maps of the secret cultist base, plus a wealth of narrative and story information that details the Cult of the Iron Mask and the cultists associated with it.

boardgame.name: Gnome Crystal Mine
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

AA D&D 3.5e mini-adventure site for 4–6 Characters Level 1–2

The Gnome Crystal Mine is a mini-adventure that you can use in your existing fantasy adventure. The encounter location comes complete with maps, tokens, and Game Master Story Notes.

Deep inside a nearby forest a trio of Gnomes toil deep within the earth, in search of magical crystals. Crystals demanded by the wizard community for weird science experiments, delving into the wonders of the magical arts. But the flow of crystals from the mine has come to a sudden halt as ferocious Forest Cats have invaded the mine!

Having fled for their lives, the Gnomes now petition passing parties of adventurers for help to evict the feline squatters and retake the Crystal Mine. Offering intrepid adventurers who can accomplish the task a ransom of precious uncut crystals, worth a small fortune to the wizard community.

The forest cats now lurk within the dark confides of the Gnome Crystal Mine, having turned the caves within into a den. But why the mine when there is a plentiful forest outside, and why now? Unbeknown to the Gnomes, their burrowing through stone and crystal is slowly, with each shove full of earth, with each removed stone, the Gnome brothers are slowly uncovering an ancient stone prison.

Quite by accident the Gnomes are digging through ancient cave tunnels that were once upon a time converted into a prison for a long forgotten menace. A terror that has long since faded from living memory since it was imprisoned. The very crystals that the Gnomes excavate from the rock walls of the mine are by-products of the entities magical presence within it’s windowless stone prison.
Compass Point Contents

The Gnome Crystal Mine is a mini-adventure site, or as we call it at Studio WyldFurr: a Compass Point that a Dungeon Master can drop into their campaign as a side adventure or as an adventure all by itself. The package includes everything the Dungeon Master needs:

Maps of the Crystal Mine (dungeon and cave system).
Virtual tabletop NPC and Object tokens.
Game Master narrative and story information that details the Gnome Crystal Mine itself and the inhabitants associated with it.

boardgame.name: Distrix
boardgame.description:
Distrix is an award-winning game of skill in which two players, Red and Blue, battle to control a 6x6 region called The Matrix. The number in each square of the matrix equals power, and Red and Blue are equally powerful. During the game, players use colored tokens to group the squares into 9 districts one square at a time. A different token color is used for each district. As the districts are formed, power is unevenly allocated. Red controls some districts, and Blue controls others. Whoever controls more districts at the end of the game wins.

The idea is simple, but game play is surprisingly complex. To win, players must cleverly combine basic arithmetic, spatial awareness, and expert move timing to control many districts by small amounts, not few districts by large amounts. The zero-sum landscape creates a tense experience from start to finish in which endgame surprises are remarkably common and all games are closely contested.

Distrix is for 2 players ages 14 and up and takes 30-60 minutes to play. Each game set includes 36 tiles, 9 home base tokens, 99 expansion tokens, 9 scoring tokens, a scoreboard, a rulebook, and a rule summary sheet.

The game is abstract yet relevant. It introduces mechanics for dividing any geographic region into a given number of districts of nearly equal size. The same mechanics can be used to form election districts of nearly equal population within US states. Thus, the game offers a potential solution to America's gerrymandering problem. Instead of one political party forming new election districts, multiple political parties could form them in a high-stakes game, one voting precinct (or county) at a time.

Distrix won the Best New Abstract Game Judges Award at the 2021 UK Games Expo and a silver medal in the 2020 Serious Play Tabletop Game Competition.

The game box, components, rules, and theme were updated in June 2022 to enhance player enjoyment.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2021 UK Games Expo Best Abstract Game Nominee
2021 UK Games Expo Best New Abstract Game Judges Award Winner

boardgame.name: Town Church (Church of Knives)
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A D&D 3.5e mini-adventure site for 2–4 Characters Levels 4-5

The devotees to a strange collection of Saints who steal from the rich and give to the poor, have established a small local town church in the poor quarter of town. The monks of the Church of Knives hold services each weekend for a small congregation of followers who are attracted by the charity of the monks.

The local folk whisper of a secret treasure horde hidden in an underground vault beneath the church, a treasure horde stolen from unscrupulous merchants and Barron’s who horded too much wealth while refusing to help the destitute people of the kingdom. Having stolen only the “excessive” wealth of the Barron’s, the monks now give away the treasure as charity to the poor during their weekly sermon.

This Compass Point deals with a small town church setup for the Church of Knives. The church acts as a focus from which the Master Monk can proselytise to the peasants and distribute the charity of the cult. While under the cover of being a small town church the Master Monk and his loyal retainer are guardians of a hidden vault.
The Hidden Vault

When the church was built a secret second underground level was constructed to house a mechanic vault, a system of four chambers and a combination lock.

The vault is employed to store a limited amount of coinage which the monks distribute to the poor during sermons, while the true nature of the vault is to store cursed artifacts that the Church of Knives has discovered.
What is a Compass Point?

Our Compass Points are not self contained adventure modules, although they could easily be turned into a mini-adventure. Instead the objective of a Compass Point is to act as “filler” material that a Game Master can add into their campaign.

We provide all of the maps and NPC Data information, plus plot hooks and NPC motivation, but how the Compass Point is inserted into the GM’s running narrative is completely up to the GM.

The entire principal behind our Compass Points is,

“A Game Master can simply employ the Compass Point module to add a side-adventure to their campaign, while the Story Content provides context, hints, and tips.”

boardgame.name: The Adventure Crafter Deck
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Adventure Crafter Deck is an alternate way of using the rules for creating adventures presented in The Adventure Crafter. The deck of cards replaces the dice and the tables in the book, providing direct results for everything handled by the original book, including Theme priority, random Plotlines and Characters Lists, Theme determination, Plot Points, Turning Points, and Character Crafting. As The Adventure Crafter, The Adventure Crafter Deck works with every role-playing system and with every genre.

boardgame.name: Sputnik Eyes
boardgame.description:
Sputnik Eyes is a puzzle game that will take you on a journey across space.

Help the little Eyes to scan and explore each planet on the way. The objective is clear, the paths to reach it entwined. Use your logical thinking and help each of your robotic companions to reach its right-colored position – only then you can analyize a planet. But the positions are only reachable by a few paths.....

Developed by Shelly Alon

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Frostpunk: The Board Game – Playing Mat
boardgame.description:
This Premium Qualitay Neoprene Playing Mat can be placed underneath the main board. It is illustrated with snowy landscape that represents the surroundings of the place where the Generator was built.

The Neoprene Playmat measures 75 cm x 65 cm and has stitched corners.

boardgame.name: Frostpunk: The Board Game – Resources Expansion
boardgame.description:
This set of plastic resources match other plastic components in scale. It simply enhances the overall impression you will get if you have the Miniatures expansion. Just like the play mat, this add-on is purely of aesthetic nature and does not in any way influence the mechanics of the game. Also you have still to use the wooden coal pieces for the Generator.

Contains:

8 Steel
10 Steam Core
20 Trees
30 Coal
30 Wood

boardgame.name: El fantasma de la ópera
boardgame.description:
A young and unknown composer presents to the manager of the Opera House his latest creation, the score of an opera that fascinates the manager, who tries to appropriate it. There is a struggle between the two and the manager throws a vial of acid at the composer that burns his face turning him into a monster. The composer then took refuge with his work in the cellars of the theater. There he starts a new life and builds his own world. Years pass and one day, captivated by the voice and beauty of a young Prano, he decides to kidnap her to perform his great opera for him.

The "detectives" must enter the gloomy cellars of the theater, discover the secret passages that lead to the phantom's lair and rescue the soprano, but they must be very careful not to be discovered by the phantom that would mark them with a deadly ink tampon.

Players can become these "detectives" and put an end to the misdeeds of the Phantom of the Opera. The first player to return to the entrance having managed to rescue the soprano wins the game.

boardgame.name: Frostpunk: The Board Game – Dreadnought Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Dreadnought miniature will be used in one of the setups and one of the scenarios as an element that will increase the immersive aspect of the game even further! It's purely of aesthetic nature and does not in any way influence the mechanics of the game as it is normaly represented on game tiles.

Contains:

1 Dreadnought Miniature (19x7x5 cm)

boardgame.name: Partyrs
boardgame.description:
Thirty cheerful creatures are having a party. Beginning with a funny music-loving alien to a lazy elephant: Some pretty funny guys are invited. They are all fond of a great party and it’s your task to host it. You can make the party a success by using your logical thinking and making everyone feel comfortable. Meet all the Partyrs, think sharp and party with them!

Developed by Shelly Alon

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Frostpunk: The Board Game – Miniatures Expansion
boardgame.description:
With the miniatures on the table every building from the building tiles will come visible in 3D. They increase the immersive aspect of the game and are purely of aesthetic nature. They do not in any way influence the mechanics of the game.

Also the expansion contains plastic markers as workers, engineers, children & automatons for the wooden pendants in the core box.

Contains:

Buildings
5 special large buildings
12 large buildings
23 special small buildings
42 small buildings

Markers
2 Children in special colors
6 Automatons
8 Children
10 Engineers
10 Workers

boardgame.name: Marvel HeroClix: Battlegrounds – Avengers vs. Masters of Evil
boardgame.description:
Get Started with Battlegrounds!
The Avengers are a team of Earth’s Mightiest Heroes – can they defeat the Masters of Evil – a team of Earth’s most menacing villains? Each figure in HeroClix Battlegrounds comes with 2 cards to match their HeroClix dial; one is specifically geared toward learning to play, while the other is good for players who have already played a few games. Featuring fan-favorite heroes and recognizable villains, it will appeal to casual fans and Marvel veterans alike!

The Avengers feature Captain America, Black Widow, Iron Man, Hulk, and Captain Marvel. The Masters of Evil include Mach-X, Baron Zemo, Red Skull, Winter Soldier, and Ultron! Different combinations and teams will face off head-to-head in normal HeroClix combat or scenarios unique to this product!

This boxed-set is a great way for 2 players to learn HeroClix!

HeroClix Battlegrounds contains everything up to 4 people need to play HeroClix (Exact game components subject to change):

10 HeroClix Figures
20 HeroClix Character Cards
18 Object and Terrain Tokens
20 Action Tokens
4 Full-Color Maps
2 Six-Sided dice with the Avengers logo
1 HeroClix Powers & Abilities Card
1 HeroClix Core Rulebook
8 Scenario/Campaign Cards

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: セメタリーセメラレタリー (Cemetery Conqueror)
boardgame.description:
セメタリーセメラレタリー (Cemetery Conqueror) is a game from Japan. You are the caretaker at an old cemetery. You hear the voices of the dead call out for their families to visit. But all the graves are dirty and overgrown. You set to restoring the graves, so the families will return again and honour their ancestors.

During the game you use your dice to make money, and then bid in auctions to complete work patterns using cubes, restoring the different graves in the cemetery and expanded your influence over the graveyard.
user summary

boardgame.name: Zombies & Zilches
ゾンビデル (Zombidel)
boardgame.description:
ゾンビデル (Zombidel), meaning 'Zombies & Zilches', is a trick-taking card game from Japan, set in a movie world of zombies. The theme draws heavily on the film Dawn Of The Dead, with the players trying to escape the shopping mall occupied by zombies.

By playing out tricks, you try to remove the weak and useless zombies from your hand, and avoid being killed by stronger zombies. If you can clear your hand of any shopping mall cards, you have got free. Now you need to escape by helicopter or motorbike.

But if you take too long, you might end up back in the shopping mall!

The game is not too serious, the graphic design is humourous instead of gory.
user summary

As of August 2021, we are remaking it with English rules and new illustrations.
We will be using a kickstarter for it. It's primarily intended to help outside of Japan, so be interested!
